author: Kate Riley
excerpt: November greetings friends. Daylight savings is upon us. I have mixed feelings about it every year, while I like the light streaming through the windows a l ...
text: November greetings friends. Daylight savings is upon us. I have mixed feelings about it every year, while I like the light streaming through the windows a little earlier in the day, the five o’clock darkness is gloomy. However I’ve decided to shift my mindset about it, after all, it’s not something I can change. Therefore the focus for November will be layers of cozy: homemade soups, soft throw blankets on every sofa and chair, the opportunity to light more candles, and the anticipation of the upcoming holidays. We’re hosting Thanksgiving again so I’ll be doing the cooking with the help of my daughter and setting a simple yet festive table for twelve. Favorite links from the week: Funny lady Heidi Gardner’s cozy wood filled midcentury style home. This light and bright English Tudor home. The high contrast wall tile installation in this bathroom refresh. Low return on investment renovations if you’re not in your forever home. 24 Thanksgiving table napkin ideas. Want paperwhites blooming in your home this Christmas? Here’s a handy guide. Why crafting with nature is good for your mental health. Six ways your landscaping choices can boost your home’s value. How all 50 states got their names. 12 questions to ask yourself which may change your life. If the month of November was your friend.
html:
November greetings friends. Daylight savings is upon us. I have mixed feelings about it every year, while I like the light streaming through the windows a little earlier in the day, the five o’clock darkness is gloomy. However I’ve decided to shift my mindset about it, after all, it’s not something I can change.

Therefore the focus for November will be layers of cozy: homemade soups, soft throw blankets on every sofa and chair, the opportunity to light more candles, and the anticipation of the upcoming holidays. We’re hosting Thanksgiving again so I’ll be doing the cooking with the help of my daughter and setting a simple yet festive table for twelve.

Favorite links from the week:

Funny lady Heidi Gardner’s cozy wood filled midcentury style home.

This light and bright English Tudor home.

The high contrast wall tile installation in this bathroom refresh.

Why crafting with nature is good for your mental health.

Six ways your landscaping choices can boost your home’s value.

How all 50 states got their names.

12 questions to ask yourself which may change your life.

If the month of November was your friend.
